storyInfo: Loughshinny boards the Duke of Wellington's ship with the Doctor's help, and finally ends the ducal alliance's stalemate siege of the city as Eblana's purple flames spread onto the city walls. Loughshinny keeps her promise and returns to Tara.

attributes.text: While you, my unruly shadow—you had every opportunity to avoid involving yourself in this.
But since you decided to jump into the flames together,
Join this magnificent blaze where even shadows lose themselves.

attributes.content: So we're basically right outside Londinium?
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: That's what I heard.
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: I've never walked so much my entire life.
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: You figure you've walked more than Moran and the others?
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: Them? They followed the Leader all the way from the Scáthanna Fields, how can I even compare?
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: Well, who's counting? Besides, we're here. What now? We fight?
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: I suppose. We've been through more than our fair share of scuffles on our way here anyway—stray Sarkaz, wasteland bandits, soldiers hired by nobles...
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: Sorry, present company excluded. I meant the ones who specifically target Tarans, you know the type.
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: I know. I just wanted to say...
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: No, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: Come on, out with it. Is your leg better now? Can you do a little jig?
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: The slightly sultry breeze of early autumn blows the stench of swamp and grass into the air.
The soldier separated from his squad looks up towards Londinium. His ears are not being deafened by sporadic cannonfire, nor is the Sarkaz witchcraft he heard so much about anywhere to be seen.
Fine, I'll try. Just don't step on my leg.
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: They're dancing in the camp? I'll tell them to stop. We can't risk the noise this close to the battlefield.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: No, it's fine. We'll be safe as long as we're inside the camp.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But we have to press forward.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The road ahead passes through a battlefield, and I should go alone.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed! Moran! Come dance with us!
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: ...So you're all here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Battlefield's just up ahead. No clue how we're gonna end up...
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: But everyone's in pretty good shape for now, so let's dance while we still can!
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: Maybe if we move enough, it'll shake off the fear—
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: That's lovely, but... I'd rather everyone stay here and go no further.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Huh? We're not going to battle?
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: It's too dangerous for you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So you're going on ahead, all by your lonesome?
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: How long will you be gone?
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: I don't know. But I'll definitely return.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed, everyone who followed you here knows that fighting is inevitable.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: We all know we're not qualified to join the fray. But we want to help you, even if all we can do is to block a few bolts.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm not qualified either.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...Reed?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Be it Wellington, the other Dukes, or the Sarkaz, they are the ones tipping the scales of this war. But us...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No matter which side we choose, we'll make less of a difference on the battlefield than a speck of dust. That goes for both you and me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then why...?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: There is something I must do.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But don't mistake me. What I intend is no nobler than facing off with the Victorians for our people, swords drawn. I just... have to face it...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: To face her.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: 'The Leader'?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The Leader.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.text: Almost every Taran knows of Dublinn and 'The Leader'.
Even those not in the know will soon learn of their existence from the increased Victorian aggression after Wellington's army marched off towards Londinium.
Of course, they will also realize that the Leader of Dublinn standing before them would seem out of place with the fabled 'spectre force', or on Wellington's high-speed battleship.
But she saved them and asked nothing of them, so to them she is without a doubt The Leader.

attributes.content: People come and go. Those of us still here have already made up our minds, so don't you worry on our behalf.
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: Don't mind my wounds. I still have a chance against the restless dead.
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: You saved my life. Even if I die here, it'll be a worthy death.
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: Thank you, everyone. But we didn't come all this way to become martyrs.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The road ahead of us doesn't lead to yet more fighting. On the contrary, when I return, we'll... return to a Tara without war. Together.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So you're coming back for sure, Reed?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I am.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then we'll wait for you.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: After the battle at Silverrock Bluffs, the Royal Court forces retreated behind Londinium's walls, while Victoria's Dukes kept their forces stationed around the city, in no hurry to assault it.

Wellington's army, with their fresh new flag, did not participate in the siege, and stationed themselves just outside the warzone like an indifferent observer, coolly watching the deadlock outside the city.
But a stalemate does not necessarily mean peace. Scouting efforts and countermeasures, raids and ambushes, Sarkaz witchcraft and brief cannon barrages...
Accompanying them are the curses and groans of the immobilized wounded, unable to do anything but wait in vain for death to come. Everything comes together in a tapestry of stifling tranquility.
The Draco takes advantage of the current 'peace' and sets off to put an end to it.
How's the situation outside the city?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: A group of Victorians tried to snatch their wounded off the battlefield a few hours ago, but we bled them dry.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: But... they'll beat us to death if they spot any of us alone, and their firepower's terrifying to boot.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Captain, is it true? What that so-called Babel on the radio said the other day—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Shut up if you want to live!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: What? A Vouivre walking around outside the city? Even helping to treat the wounded? Is she mocking us? Does she think we're already as good as dead?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: I'll give you a minute. Consider your lives forfeit if she's still breathing.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: Wait, what? You're telling me she's even saving the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: Bloody devils... They've been holed up in there for days and still pack a punch...
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Personally, I'd rather the siege continue.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Old Wellington's not in the siege. Changed flags and retreated to his own camp. It's obvious he no longer wants to fight the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Her Grace the Duke of Caster, in her magnanimity, has ordered us to not pursue the matter any further, but where are we going to find more unlucky blokes to hold off the Sarkaz troops?
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I mean, I'm certainly not volunteering for the duty.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Are there even any Victorians left in the city, what with so many wounded soldiers out here on the field?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Reporting in. We have... returned.
attributes.name: Wounded Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: What?! How?! Everyone we sent to rescue you never came back!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: A Vouivre... a Caster, she saved us.
attributes.name: Wounded Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: A Vouivre? Which Duke does she serve? Gododdin? Fife?
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: No idea. She didn't even seem to care which side we were on.
attributes.name: Wounded Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Sod it, just who was she? You're saying she was going, what, towards the city?
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Seemed like... to the Gastrell.
attributes.name: Wounded Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: I'm sorry, this is all I can do for you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's okay. I'm just relieved... my chest doesn't hurt anymore, at least.
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: Thank you so much, Leader. I've seen you before, at Oak Grove... You said then, 'The flames have already been kindled.'
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: So now I'll become one of the restless dead, and continue fighting for Tara even after I die, right?
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: Is that what you want?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then my answer is this: You won't.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: The flames will indeed swallow up many lives, but never should they intentionally use life as tinder. That isn't how flame is meant to be used.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Do you know the legend of the watchmen? Those who send returning Taran warriors to sleep in flame, so they may finally know rest.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Your fight is over, soldier. I hope you find rest just as they did.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Leader, I can't...
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: This is an order.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...As you command.
attributes.name: Dying Taran

attributes.content: Brigadier, sir.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: What's the situation with our target?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: She's been treating any wounded on her way, but otherwise has been headed straight towards our camp. She'll soon reach the Gastrell's gangway.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: What of the Sarkaz and the other Dukes' movements?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have made a few probing attacks with small squads, but are evidently unaware of the situation and have failed to slow her down.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Continue surveillance, and prepare for her to board. Eliminate any threat to her life.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Another thing, Brigadier, sir. We and you Tarans... have already become companions on the battlefield after risking our lives together, yes?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: No need to beat around the bush. Ask me any question you have.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I've heard some rumors regarding the target. That you once planned to get rid of her.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: So why are you protecting her now?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Reporting in. Target is at the gangway!
attributes.name: Communicator

attributes.content: (Inquiring look)
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Let her board. Bring her to the command center.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: (Mouthing) The bridge?!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: ...Let her board, and bring her to the Gastrell's command center.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Communicator

attributes.content: I thought... you would have welcomed her personally.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I'm no longer qualified.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Your Grace?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I thought the one waiting for me... would be my sister.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It is inconvenient for Princess Eblana to meet you at the moment, Miss Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: But I am quite interested in how you managed to obtain the G-0 high ground coordinates. Is it the pharmaceutical company you stay at? That Doctor?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then, milady, would you kindly pass along a message? The Doctor will have to personally come and get whatever is wanted from Tara.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The Doctor was only helping me meet my sister, expecting nothing from Tara. Only hoping to end the war sooner. And I agree.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Pardon my frankness, Miss Loughshinny, but I see only a mouthpiece here, and I believe mouthpieces have no authority to make suggestions.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I am no go-between. I represent only myself.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then I shall hear you out.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: What exactly do you want?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Peace.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Peace?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The cannons still ring, the Sarkaz witchcraft still hovers above our heads, and you speak of peace?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: It is only because I am meeting you in good faith that I will choose not to regard that as an insult to this war.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: That is absolutely not my intention.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: This war continues not because it cannot be ended, Your Grace. Even I can tell the Sarkaz are running out of time.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The Victorians have surrounded the city but have refrained from an assault, in order to preserve their strength.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I suppose they plan to starve out the city.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They do not care if any of their own countrymen remain inside. It does not matter if there actually are, so long as they don't see a single one when they eventually enter the city.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: An ugly tactic, if there ever was one.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The root of ugliness is cowardice, as it always has been.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The morality of one's actions does not diminish its cowardice, Miss Loughshinny. Cowardice is when you hesitate to take responsibility.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: ...Which is why I am standing before you now.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I hope that you and your forces can put an end to this ugly siege, break the Sarkaz's fragile front, and spare every Victorian in the city from the calamity created by their own people.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I see. Now I understand why you have come.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: As Her Highness Eblana has said, you show both compassion and nobility. But these virtues of yours are far from a reason for the Tarans to once again involve themselves in a conflict between the Sarkaz and the Victorians.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The Gastrell would not be stationed here if intervention was never an option.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I asked for a reason, Miss Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I, the Gastrell, and the countless other Taran warriors require a reason good enough for us to risk our own lives.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Please, Your Grace.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: 'Please' has no power on the battlefield.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Reed tries her best to look straight into Wellington's eyes.
She knows well what holds the most power on the battlefield. She knows she is qualified to wield it—and that that right is all she has.
She also knows that once she uses it, there will be no turning back.
But she was never uninvolved, and that is precisely why she came here.
(Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then, Your Grace, I... I order... you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: In the name of Tara.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I order you to rescue the Victorian civilians inside the city.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I order your fleet to smash the weak Sarkaz defense line, to bring Londinium the relief she should have had long ago.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I order the Taran army to demonstrate noblesse oblige, not for material benefit, but for all to see our glory.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: As you command.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Any other orders?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You've been stationed outside Londinium this whole time, yet you acquiesced to my command so easily... Could it be because my sister...?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: My presence here means only one thing: that once again, I was able to witness the cowardice and evil of the Victorians.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: As long as you are willing to give orders, you will have command.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You merely made a choice. To align yourself with Her Highness Eblana, and the newborn Tara.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: ...I did.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I would have come here even if the city was not being besieged.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: If so, then I believe Her Highness will soon find the time to grant you an audience. I'm sorry to say, but this truly is an inconvenient time for her to meet you.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: What is she planning?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Does it matter? Whether it succeeds or fails, it will nonetheless benefit Tara.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: ...Truly?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She made a promise. And she will honor it.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Do excuse me.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The command center returns to silence as Reed scrutinizes the conversation they just had.
She completed some of her objectives and learned a few things, but is left even more puzzled.
She has stepped in, and can no longer turn back.
Miss Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: You are...?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The general ordered me to escort you out and show you to your cabin.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: You may spend your time aboard the Gastrell as you please before we reach Taran territory.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: My apologies, but there are people waiting for me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Do you mean the Tarans who have been following you?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The general did consider this. He is willing to send a squad to lead them to our camp here, and let them board a ride on a support ship back to the capital, Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: No, I promised them I would return.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Just as I am promising you right now, and have promised His Grace, that I will return to Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I believe we made that clear in our earlier exchange.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: My apologies, but I'll need to ask the general about this...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: He's busy? Ugh... But...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: What?! With your busy schedule, even...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Y—Yes! As you command!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Miss Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: I'm listening.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Direct orders from The Leader. She has instructed us not to interfere with your movements.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: 'The Leader'?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: But she does ardently hope that you can stay just a little while longer.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: To witness a grand performance.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Are you sure about not meeting her personally?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: No need to.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Strictly speaking, the war has yet to end. Nothing good will come of meeting Loughshinny now. It would only bring her more confusion.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Very well, Your Highness. Please return to the command center and await the good news.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Hold on.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Seeing that Loughshinny is willing to tie her own fate to Tara's, we should show her the might of the nation she is about to be a part of.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Rest assured. We would demonstrate it with the Sarkaz's prompt defeat.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: But if you prefer a more personal show of force, the Gastrell is more than willing to oblige.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Consider it a grand welcome.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As my dear sister has made her wishes clear, shouldn't I help her realize them with my own hands?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Didn't I tell you it doesn't matter where that Vouivre came from? She's helping the Victorians, so she's got to die. Simple as that.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: We're... We're no match for her.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: You're worthless!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: ...Bah, forget it. It's just one Vouivre—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: What was that noise?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: A—A high-speed battleship! Currently speeding towards the city walls!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Victorian?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: It's the Gastrell—it's that Duke of Wellington guy!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Not just him, Caster's fleet seems to be spontaneously coordinating with his ships!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Raid! Raid incoming—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout Captain

attributes.content: Purple flames?! Captain—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Scout

attributes.content: Atop the Gastrell's bow stands The Leader of Dublinn, purple flames spreading from the tip of her spear to the city walls.
Her flames of death erupt from the Sarkaz on the perimeter, spreading to adjacent victims as they wantonly seek the next host, leaving only the floating Nachzehrer untouched by fire.
Nachzehrer. 'God of War'? 'Lord of War and Death'?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A shame there is no longer enough death here to sate you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Even living legends have their endings. But surely becoming the kindling of a new legend is better than wasting away in obscurity?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Oh. The brazenly ambitious young Draco.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Very well then.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Red Dragon who toys with life and death on a spear. Just how well do you comprehend death?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I suppose this is not the worst way to kill time before the war is over.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Do try to hold on a little longer, Nachzehrer.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Let us show those Victorians what death truly is, while the artillery still rings.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I have waited a long time, young Draco.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You are bolder than the others.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Then use those flames of yours to send a message to those cowards surrounding the city—
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I am here.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The war is here.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The stench of rot thickens as the ice-cold flames of death rage.
Death crashes into death, over the faint shelling and thin city walls.
Th—They really started fighting?
attributes.name: Landless Farmer

attributes.content: Did The Leader...
attributes.name: Refugee Artisan

attributes.content: Shush! There's no way she'd...
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: No. We have to go find her.
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: We promised we'd wait for her here.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But the fighting's broken out in Londinium again!
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: ...Just believe in her—
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I do, but listen! That's the sound of witchcraft, and the Dukes' cannons! How could The Leader—
attributes.name: Wounded Abandoned Soldier

attributes.content: —Like she believes in us.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The wounded soldier is left speechless, only able to look back on the tranquility now torn apart by flame and chaos. Searching for a reason for his squad to join the battlefield.
Past the smoke and mire he sees a figure.
The Leader. Reed. Loughshinny.
She finished her own fight, held true to her promise, and returns to lead them on, to the end of their journey...
To home, to peace.
Let's go, everyone.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What is happening there is no longer something we can involve ourselves in.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's time to head home.
attributes.name: Reed
